sections.title: What is your VAT registration number?

fields.label: What is your VAT registration number?
fields.helpText: This is 9 numbers, sometimes with ‘GB’ at the start, for example 123456789 or GB123456789. You can find it on your VAT registration certificate.

sections.title: Is your business in run off?

fields.label: Is your business in run off?
fields.helpText: A business that is in run off is no longer writing new insurance policies but is liable for outstanding claims

sections.title: Are you applying to register for Insurance Premium Tax because a business has been transferred to you as a going concern?

fields.label: Are you applying to register for Insurance Premium Tax because a business has been transferred to you as a going concern?
fields.shortName: Transferring a business as a going concern
fields.helpText: A going concern is when the transferred business will continue to receive taxable premiums after the transfer date, without any significant break in trading

sections.title: Enter the details of the business transfer

fields.label: transferExplanation
fields.infoText: Enter the details of the business that has been transferred to you.

fields.label: Business name
fields.helpText: Enter the name of the business that has been transferred

fields.label: Insurance Premium Tax registration number of the previous owner
fields.helpText: This is 11 numbers with 4 letters at the start, for example XIPT12345678911. It is used for all returns, payments and correspondence.

fields.label: Do you wish to keep the Insurance Premium Tax number of the previous owner?
fields.shortName: I want to keep the previous IPT number

fields.label: Select your business accounting scheme
fields.helpText: Tell HMRC which scheme you are going to use from the first of your accounting periods

sections.title: Which classes of insurance do you provide?

fields.label: Which classes of insurance do you provide?
More about insurance classes
fields.infoText: To find out more about which insurance classes are liable for Insurance Premium Tax, open a new window and go to Section 5 of Notice IPT1: Insurance Premium Tax on GOV.UK.

sections.title: What date do you expect to receive your first taxable premium?

fields.label: What date do you expect to receive your first taxable premium?

sections.title: How much taxable premium income do you expect to receive in the first 12 months?

fields.label: How much taxable premium income do you expect to receive in the first 12 months?
fields.helpText: The 12 month period starts from the date of your expected taxable premium. If you do not know enter an estimate instead.

declarationSection.title: Make your declaration and send the form

fields.label: test
fields.infoText: By submitting this registration you confirm that the information you have provided is true and complete.

HMRC have sent you a confirmation email. We will not contact you about this application unless we require further information.

If your application is successful, we will send a certificate of registration to your correspondence address. We will issue this within 15 working days of you submitting your IPT1 Application for Registration. It will give your IPT registration number and show your date of registration. It will also tell you when your first return is due.

This is your last opportunity to print or save a pdf copy of your submitted form.
